intro: Trichostema rubisepalum, commonly known as the red-sepal stickseed, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color, with distinctive, hairy sepals that give it its common name. Trichostema rubisepalum is an annual or biennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
